tourBios.curYrHigh: Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica exempt status by sharing runner-up honors at the Bogota Q-School in January… Posted four rounds of par or better, including 68s on the first and final rounds, to finish T4 at the season-opening 69th Avianca Colombia Open presented by BBVA in Rionegro, Colombia in February. As the low Colombian pro at the event, he was awarded a sponsor exemption for the Web.com Tour event to be played in Cartagena, Colombia in April.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Joined PGA TOUR Latinoamérica with a T6 finish at the Lima, Peru Q-School in January… Made the cut in 6 of 13 events on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, where his only top-25 was T17 at the season-opening 68th Avianca Colombian Open in March. Finished the season ranked 102nd on the Order of Merit.

2014: Playing on sponsor exemptions he missed the cut on his first two career starts on the Web.com Tour in Bogota and Panama City… Missed the cut in all four of his starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica.

2013: Played six events on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, where hies best of two cuts made was T28 at the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic in November.

2012: Missed the cut on his first two career on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, playing the two events the Tour had in his country.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played college golf at Texas Tech… Had one college win at the 2007 Herb Wimberly Intercollegiate… Won the 2006 Colombian Junior Amateur Match Play... Finished seventh at the 2006 Junior Orange Bowl Championship... Competed in multiple AJGA events in 2006 while attending The Heritage Academy in Hilton Head Island, S.C…. Won both the Colombian Amateur and Junior Championships in 2005… Took eighth at the South American Junior Championship that same year, when Colombia won the team competition.
tourBios.personal: Has two sisters (Giovanna & Paola) and two brothers (Esteban & Alejandro)… Loves cooking and says he would be a chef if not a professional golfer… His biggest thrill in golf was shooting 31 on the back nine to win the Colombian Open Amateur Championship… Biggest thrill outside of golf is spending time with his nephews… His favorite athlete outside of golf is Roger Federer… Colombia's Millonarios, the New England Patriots and the Dallas Mavericks are his favorite pro teams… A concert by Carlos Vives in Bogota is the best entertainment event he has ever attended… Twitter name is @sergiofranky… Instagram name is @sfranky1
tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 2-11 at 2016 Q-School (exempt to midseason reshuffle)

tourBios.curYearHigh: Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica exempt status by sharing runner-up honors at the Bogota Q-School in January… Posted four rounds of par or better, including 68s on the first and final rounds, to finish T4 at the season-opening 69th Avianca Colombia Open presented by BBVA in Rionegro, Colombia in February. As the low Colombian pro at the event, he was awarded a sponsor exemption for the Web.com Tour event to be played in Cartagena, Colombia in April.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri in 2016 is T4th at the 69 Avianca Colombia Open presentado por BBVA.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T16th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Latinoamérica.
